definitions.definition: intend to convey, indicate, or refer to (a particular thing or notion); signify.
examples: I don't know what you mean
synonyms: point to; literarybetoken "flashing lights mean the road is blocked"

definitions.definition: (of a word) have (something) as its signification in the same language or its equivalent in another language.
examples: its name means “painted rock” in Cherokee

definitions.definition: genuinely intend to convey or express (something).
examples: when she said that before, she meant it

definitions.definition: be of some specified importance to (someone), especially as a source of benefit or object of affection.
examples: animals have always meant more to him than people

definitions.definition: intend (something) to occur or be the case.
synonyms: expect "she didn't mean to break it"

definitions.definition: be supposed or intended to do something.
examples: we were meant to go over yesterday

definitions.definition: design or destine for a particular purpose.
examples: the jacket was meant for a much larger person
synonyms: predestine "he was hit by a bullet meant for a soldier"

definitions.definition: have as a motive or excuse in explanation.
examples: what do you mean by leaving me out here in the cold?
synonyms: be significant "this means a lot to me"

definitions.definition: have as a consequence or result.
examples: the proposals are likely to mean another hundred closures
synonyms: produce More"the closures will mean a rise in unemployment"presage
bode; literarybetoken "a red sky in the morning usually means rain"

definitions.definition: necessarily or usually entail or involve.
examples: coal stoves mean a lot of smoke
